Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of a ram facing forward. Fragment. Hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous red-brown Nile silt.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Figure probably originally accomodated a rider. Close parallel, of Harpocrates riding a ram, dated by Bailey to the 3rd or 2nd centuries BC (Bailey 2008, 3084; British Museum GR 1928,0612.1; Higgins 1967: pl. 63c; Fischer 1994: 279, no. 622), but previously considered to be 1st or 2nd century AD. See also terracotta rams from Ras el- Soda, found with early Ptolemaic material (Adriani 1952, Pl.24.1). Adriani, A. 1952, Municipalité d’Alexandrie, Annuaire du Musée Gréco-Romain. Volume III (1940-1950), Alexandria. Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.060) (Phase 3)
